title: Type-aware validation using graph-stored types
description: Node/edge creation validates against NodeType/EdgeType nodes in graph at runtime, not just TS compile-time. Flow: createNode() queries graph for type definition, validates properties, throws if invalid. Enables user-defined types without code changes.

title: EdgeType schema as graph node
description: Define EdgeType node structure: id, name, sourceTypes[], targetTypes[], properties[], transitive, symmetric, inverse. Constrains which node types can connect via which edge types. Location: @canopy/core or @canopy/types.

title: Bootstrap system types on graph creation
description: When createGraph() is called, auto-populate with: NodeType (self-describing), EdgeType, core edge types (childof, defines, ref, extends), base node types (Node, Block, TextBlock, CodeBlock). This is the graph's boot sector. Location: bootstrapGraph() in @canopy/core.

title: Query definitions as nodes
description: Queries stored as nodes: id, name, language (cypher), query string, parameters[], cacheable. Enables saved queries, view references, embedded live queries. Depends on meta-circular foundation.

title: NodeType schema as graph node
description: Define NodeType node structure: id, name, properties[], requiredProperties[], validOutgoingEdges[], validIncomingEdges[], icon, color. Must be self-describing (NodeType describes NodeType). Location: @canopy/core or @canopy/types.

title: Meta-circular foundation
description: Type definitions (NodeType, EdgeType) exist as queryable nodes in the graph. This is Canopy's core differentiator - the graph can introspect its own schema. Current state: types are TS interfaces only, not graph nodes.

title: Refactor legacy classes to functional patterns
description: Refactor packages/sync, packages/storage, and packages/query (engine.ts, legacy.ts) to remove class usage and comply with functional/no-this-expressions.

title: Event emission system
description: Graph operations emit events for UI reactivity and sync. Events: node:created/updated/deleted, edge:created/updated/deleted, graph:loaded/saved. Simple EventEmitter pattern. Enables UI updates and CRDT sync layer.

title: Audit current implementation vs spec
description: Review existing @canopy/core, @canopy/types code. Report: what exists for NodeType/EdgeType (TS interfaces vs graph nodes), what graph operations exist, what validation exists. Output: comment on this task with findings. Do not change code yet.
